Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with an applied vertical band handle and a small plain discus within a high rim, which is decorated with rays terminating in a row of raised points. The shoulder is decorated with large cabled ovules enclosing targets in relief; just above the carination is a band of raised points. The short rounded nozzle is divided from the body by a band of rays. The lamp stands on a undefined flat resting-surface. Covered with an orange slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2217)
